DataElement.preferredDefinition: Coded value representing a person's self-identified racial category as defined in the Health Information National Trends Survey.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._An arbitrary classification of taxonomic group that is a division of a species; usually arise as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and characterised by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution.

Property.preferredDefinition: An arbitrary classification of taxonomic group that is a division of a species; usually arise as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and characterised by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution.

Concepts.definition: A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/29/13mn-versioned DEC due to conceptual domain. changed from UML Default CD to Property or Attribute.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: code representing racial origination based on OMB approved categories.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands. (OMB)

Concepts.longName: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, including Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Mongolia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. The concept refers also to individuals who classify themselves as described below.

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, including for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. (OMB)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: African American; term used in the United States to categorize a population group comprised of persons having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa, most of whose ancestors were brought from Africa to the Americas as slaves between the sixteenth and nineteenth centuries. Includes population subgroups, e.g. Kenyan, Nigerian, or Haitian. The concept refers also to individuals who classify themselves as described.

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa. Terms such as "Haitian" or "Negro" can be used in addition to "Black or African American". (OMB)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa. (OMB)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Modified to meet best practice criteria. Released as part of UML model cleanup. mc 10/31/11

ReferenceDocuments.name: Data Element Person Race Number Code does not have Preferred Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Data Element Person Race Number Code does not have Preferred Question Text

DataElement.changeDescription: Versioned to associate with versioned DEC. mc 9/3/2013
